cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, then forecast to sweep northeast across south-central Georgia and move offshore near the Georgia/South Carolina coast before continuing up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach, FL

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet NC, including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Englewood FL to Suwannee River FL, west of Mexico Beach FL to Walton/Bay County line, and Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast Big Bend, then Atlantic coasts of GA, SC, and NC north-eastward
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty squalls; sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) are unlikely at the port (≤4% chance).
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain and brief squalls on 2 Sep.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip-currents along the Palm Beach County beaches.
